intro: Dysoxylum oubatchense, commonly known as the Oubatche dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
